result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Scott Joseph Mariana was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 2 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Defendant to report to Probation today March 17, 2016 by 2:00 p.m.
Defendant is entitled to 8 days credit under 973.155.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.

-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with G. Eckes.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA within 30 days and follow any recommended treatment.

DE appeared at the counter to set up Pplan @ 12:10 pm & was advised the Pymt Clerk would call him to set up an appt.  I called the DE & advised him to continue the Pplan he is currently on for $75/mo until he gets his final bill from the court with his Attorney's final bill.  DE was advised that his next pymt of $75 is due 4-01-16.  DE also inquired about the bond on 15CF430 & was advised that it was going to be applied to the assessments on 15CF233.  jaf

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Christopher Stephen Petros   DF:  Scott Joseph Mariana appeared. Includes 15CF233 and 15CF430. Case called at 11:32 am. ADA Minser recites agreement and files amended information with the court. No objection from Atty Petros.   Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count two and three, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of count two and three. Court withholds entering conviction in Count 2 in favor of Diversion Agreement. 15CF430 read in and dismissed for purposes of restitution.O n Count three court orders, 1 year probation w/h with conditions -

- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- No contact with G. Eckes

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on May 29, 2015 at 09:15 am.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Gordon Eckes II .  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
